summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting assistance to pick up evidence related to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein's sexual exploitation and abuse of minors. It mentions the involvement of co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell and outlines her charges and upcoming trial. The document emphasizes the ongoing investigation and the need to log evidence from a victim/witness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the investigation, charged with sex trafficking and conspiracy in July 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned as a co-conspirator who assisted Epstein in the abuse of minors and has been charged with multiple offenses related to these crimes.

connections.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is described as having assisted and facilitated Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged and arrested for sex trafficking and conspiracy.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged and arrested with multiple offenses including enticement of a minor.

events.title: Maxwell's Superseding Indictment
events.description: A superseding indictment charged Ghislaine Maxwell with sex trafficking of a minor and conspiracy.

events.title: Maxwell's Trial
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's trial is set to take place in the fall of 2021.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI electronic communication requesting evidence collection related to Jeffrey Epstein's case.
Jeffrey Epstein was arrested in July 2019 for sex trafficking and conspiracy.
Ghislaine Maxwell is identified as a co-conspirator who facilitated Epstein's abuse and was arrested in July 2020.
Maxwell faces multiple charges, including sex trafficking of a minor, with her trial scheduled for fall 2021.
The document references a victim/witness who is subject to a protective order.
